messageBody:
Hi Saurav, Hi "hyysguyang",

On 7/30/07, hyysguyang <hyysguyang@...> wrote:
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "sauravkr" <sauravkr@...> wrote:
> >
> > I expect another annotation in apart from @before and @After that is
> > @Finally. That should behave like finally and can be used for
> valuable
> > work like closing file or IO in case of exception has occurred.
> >
> > Also, I want some annotation instead of @beforeClass which can be
> > applied for non static method and called only once as Constructors
> > are called in normal java.
>
> If you want some method called only once as Constructors are you can
> try the instantial blok statement.
> e.g:
> public class Person(){
> private String name;
>
> {
> initName();
> }
>
> public void initName(){this.name="init name...";}
> }

I would recommend avoiding using the initialization block for any test
setup/teardown because it is not guaranteed that the same instance of
a test class is going to be reused throughout all tests.

Go with @Before/@After instead.

Lasse
